Preparatory Com. to Commemorate Day of Sun Formed in Uzbekistan
articles.content:
Preparatory Com. to Commemorate Day of Sun Formed in Uzbekistan 
    Pyongyang, March 30 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee of the United Confederation of Koreans in Uzbekistan to commemorate the Day of the Sun, the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung, was formed in Tashkent on Mar. 22.
 The inaugural meeting elected chairman, vice-chairman and members of the preparatory committee.    
 The preparatory committee decided to hold colorful functions such as a meeting to remember Kim Il Sung, a seminar, a lecture, a film show and an art performance on the occasion of the day.

WPK's Stand Supported by Malian Party Leader
articles.content:
WPK's Stand Supported by Malian Party Leader 
    Pyongyang, March 30 (KCNA) -- The chairman of the African Party for the Solidarity and Justice of Mali supported the resolute stand and efforts of
the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) to defend the country's sovereignty and national destiny despite the U.S. moves to stifle the DPRK, when meeting DPRK Ambassador to Mali Kim Pong Hui on Mar. 16.
 We reject the U.S. assertion that no other countries but the U.S. can have access to nuclear weapons, he said, stressing that the DPRK's stand on the nuclear issue is just.    
 We believe that the Korean people single-mindedly united around leader Kim Jong Il will achieve the country's reunification in the near future, he said.

Yemeni President Supports Korean People's Struggle
articles.content:
Yemeni President Supports Korean People's Struggle 
    Pyongyang, March 30 (KCNA) -- Yemen is encouraged by the efforts made by the DPRK to ensure peace in the Korean Peninsula and fairly settle the
nuclear issue. We wish the Korean people greater success in their efforts to build a great prosperous powerful nation and achieve the country's reunification.
 Yemeni President Ali Abdullah Saleh said this when receiving credentials from DPRK Ambassador to Yemen Jang Myong Son on Mar. 26.    
 Noting that he is pleased with the long-standing friendly and cooperative relations between Yemen and the DPRK, he stressed that he would make every possible effort to boost the relations between the two countries in various fields in the future.

Football Match Held between DPRK and Iranian Teams
articles.content:
Football Match Held between DPRK and Iranian Teams
    Pyongyang, March 30 (KCNA) -- A football match between the DPRK and Iranian teams took place at Kim Il Sung Stadium in Pyongyang Wednesday for the 18th World Cup Asian regional qualifier.
 The Iranian team won the match 2-0.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials
    Pyongyang, March 30 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, received credentials from Dante Martinelli, Swiss ambassador to DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
 Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, was on hand.    
 After receiving credentials the president had a conversation with the ambassador.

Congratulations to Prime Minister of Namibia
articles.content:
Congratulations to Prime Minister of Namibia
    Pyongyang, March 30 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a congratulatory message to Nahas Angula on his appointment as prime minister of Namibia.
 Expressing the belief that the good friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to develop on good terms, the message sincerely wished him success in his new job.

articles.title: Congratulatory Message to Guinean Foreign Minister
articles.content:
Congratulatory Message to Guinean Foreign Minister
    Pyongyang, March 30 (KCNA) -- Paek Nam Sun, foreign minister of the DPRK, sent a congratulatory message to Fatoumata Kaba upon his appointment as foreign minister of Guinea.
 Expressing belief that the traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger, the message sincerely wished the foreign minister success in his new job.
